gdi.ws0809.test
Class SokobanTestAdapter

java.lang.Object
  gdi.ws0809.test.SokobanTestAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
SokobanTest
public class SokobanTestAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements SokobanTest

Provide an implementation for SokobanTest in this class. Your game must compile and run without this class. This class is just meant to adapt the test cases to your implementation.

Author:
daniel

Description copied from interface: SokobanTest
Load a set of levels from a directory. The levels should be sorted alphabetically. It should not load the first level yet. Loading the first level should only happen after a call to startNextLevel().

createHighscoreEntry

public boolean createHighscoreEntry(java.lang.String playername,
                                    int i,
                                    int j,
                                    int k)
Description copied from interface: SokobanTest
Creates a new entry in the highscore list if the given data describes a new highscore entry. If the specified entry already exists or has too many steps to be a highscore, nothing happens and false is returned.

Specified by:
createHighscoreEntry in interface SokobanTest
Parameters:
playername - The name of the player that has achieved the score
i - A unique number identifying the level in which the score has been reached
j - The count of moves the player has needed to complete the specified level
k - The time the player has needed to solve the level in seconds
Returns:
True if a new entry in the highscore list has been created, otherwise false

getBestPlayerName

public java.lang.String getBestPlayerName()
Description copied from interface: SokobanTest
Gets the name of the best player (the one with with the least moves) over all levels. If Player A has completed level L1 with 10 moves and level L2 with 15 moves and player B has completed level L2 with 11 moves, the correct return value would be "A" as he has achieved to complete a level with only 10 moves. If the highscore list is empty, an empty string shall be returned.

Specified by:
getBestPlayerName in interface SokobanTest
Returns:
The name of the player with the least moves

public void clearHighscoreList()
Description copied from interface: SokobanTest
Clears the highscore list. You can either remove all entries from the "highscore.txt" file or remove the whole file. If there is no highscore file at the moment, nothing should happen.
